alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:19AM EST until January 10 at 7:09PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. The bridge at Upper Wolf Creek Road, Shephards Lane, and the east end of Applegate Road at Buck Creek are impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 27.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.8 feet on 12/15/1951. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 11 AM.
